Subject: Fwd: Getting Started
Body:
Accidentally sent this to Adam@FullCircleMarketing.co

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Peterson Rainey <peterson@fullcirclemedia.co>
Date: Sat, Sep 27, 2025 at 12:35 PM
Subject: Getting Started
To: <adam@fullcirclemarketing.co>


I can't seem to find access to the ads@FullCircleMarketing.co account. You
could send that login information over again, that would be great.

 Additionally, for Google Ads accounts, I'll be setting up a Manager
account underneath my Creekside Manager account that is called Full Circle
Marketing. This way, I can have all Google Ads accounts plugged in to my
MCC account and easily access all the ad accounts you guys send over to me
while still appearing as a direct operator of Full Circle Marketing.

 For the Facebook accounts, I'll probably just get it shared to my personal
account because that's what I have access to. All of my ad accounts are
through my personal account, and there's typically issues with business
emails getting access to Business Manager accounts in my experience. Just
want to give you a quick update on what's going on there.

If we could keep communication strictly to Slack, that way all of my team
members are able to see all of the strategy/updates on clients that we
discuss and are also able to directly communicate with you when needed.
That way we don't have to go back and forth between different emails.

I've set up forwarding for this email to send it to my business email. If I
need to communicate with new clients about onboarding and stuff like that,
that won't be an issue.

But once we start working with clients, I would like to keep all of the
communication in a dedicated Slack channel. One per client. Or two if we
need a Slack channel that doesn't have a client in it.

-- 
*Peterson Rainey*
Google Ads + Meta Ads Consultant
p. 931-342-4114

*Full Circle Media  *
www.fullcirclemedia.co
@fullcirclemediaco <https://www.instagram.com/fullcirclemediaco/>

Subject: Getting Started
Body:
I can't seem to find access to the ads@FullCircleMarketing.co account. You
could send that login information over again, that would be great.

 Additionally, for Google Ads accounts, I'll be setting up a Manager
account underneath my Creekside Manager account that is called Full Circle
Marketing. This way, I can have all Google Ads accounts plugged in to my
MCC account and easily access all the ad accounts you guys send over to me
while still appearing as a direct operator of Full Circle Marketing.

 For the Facebook accounts, I'll probably just get it shared to my personal
account because that's what I have access to. All of my ad accounts are
through my personal account, and there's typically issues with business
emails getting access to Business Manager accounts in my experience. Just
want to give you a quick update on what's going on there.

If we could keep communication strictly to Slack, that way all of my team
members are able to see all of the strategy/updates on clients that we
discuss and are also able to directly communicate with you when needed.
That way we don't have to go back and forth between different emails.

I've set up forwarding for this email to send it to my business email. If I
need to communicate with new clients about onboarding and stuff like that,
that won't be an issue.

But once we start working with clients, I would like to keep all of the
communication in a dedicated Slack channel. One per client. Or two if we
need a Slack channel that doesn't have a client in it.

-- 
*Peterson Rainey*
Google Ads + Meta Ads Consultant
p. 931-342-4114

*Full Circle Media  *
www.fullcirclemedia.co
@fullcirclemediaco <https://www.instagram.com/fullcirclemediaco/>

Wordpress, to peterson@creeksidemarketingpros.com per Jamie's

*Kahli Toy *

Primal Trust™ Academy and Community
www.primaltrust.org
My timezone: AEST (Australia)

products and services or any other persons services and instruction in the
mentorship and community, and also acknowledge that you take full
responsibility for your health, life and wellbeing, as well as the health,
lives and wellbeing of any dependents.

Subject: getting access to all things marketing
Body:
Adam asked me to reach out to you personally to get access sent to my email
that I'm sending you this on. Please let me know if you need any help
getting access sent over to me. I'd be happy to send instruction videos on
any of that.

The sooner we get access to this stuff, the sooner we can get rolling with
managing the ads.

Thanks!

-- 
*Peterson Rainey*

Subject: Tips for using your new inbox
Body:
Tips for using your new inbox
[image: Gmail]

Welcome to your inbox
[image: Search]
Find emails fast
With the power of Google Search in your inbox, you can archive
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/6576?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
all your email and find it
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/6593?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
later in a flash. Your inbox stays tidy, and you never need to worry about
what to keep.
[image: Personalize]
Personalize Full Circle Media Mail
Customize inbox backgrounds, email signatures, and other options in Full
Circle Media Mail settings
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/6562?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>.
Review and adjust your privacy and security settings at My Account
<https://myaccount.google.com/>.
[image: Organize]
Organize your email
You can organize email with labels
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/118708?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>,
which are like folders, but you can add more than one label to a message.
You can also use filters
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/6579?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
to automatically sort and categorize messages as they come in.
[image: Social]
Chat and meet directly from your inbox
Message with contacts in Google Chat
<https://support.google.com/chat/answer/9341104?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
and start video meetings with up to 100 people in Google Meet
<https://support.google.com/mail/answer/9822902?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
all without leaving Gmail.

Get training and tips
Find Gmail guides, tips, cheat sheets, help switching from Microsoft®
Outlook®, and more at the Google Workspace Learning Center
<https://support.google.com/a/users/answer/9259748?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>
.
Visit the Learning Center
<https://support.google.com/a/users/answer/9259748?hl=en&utm_source=gmailwelcomeemail&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=gmailwelcome>

Happy emailing,
The Gmail Team
[image: Google Cloud]

© 2025 Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

*You’re receiving this mandatory email service announcement to update you
about important changes to your Google Cloud product or account.*

Subject: [Action Requested] Participate in a YouTube Ads user study
Body:
Hello there,

At Google, we're always looking for ways to make our products better! We’d  
love to get your feedback on your previous experiences with YouTube Promote.

After your survey is reviewed and verified for quality and completeness,  
you will receive a 50 USD gift code by email from our incentives  
distributor. Their online catalog includes a VISA gift card, Google swag,  
charity donations, and more .

We’ve put together a 15  survey and your participation will be invaluable  
for improving our product.

Start your survey:  
https://c.gle/AF5yWjDPY1cS6TgccEVWRRBb9kNnDzf0gFHSUrcA9xRHugY9NCo-KmnokVktDD4eBmbeZoSgcDgESp34VVvwxOB8bHCmV2az854aERc1N_B9HKg6Ck_UVI3jduGKo4nqacYj4fmymYAX3yfQmj5Yw5IvSaYLSsqv-ZssnSmYDJRvF5Ql4_X-V9IBikcg6sI



Thank you for taking the time to provide your honest feedback!
YouTube Ads Research Team

Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043. This email  
was sent to peterson@fullcirclemedia.co to request your feedback. If you  
don't want to receive such emails in the future, please unsubscribe here:  
<https://myaccount.google.com/communication-preferences/unsubscribe/gt/AF5yWjA1MKinqkh5iqpcxtWpY5klU-Kmc_YRpyuBUEkrY8b9SUlT09AOcCBW2Sn947dUbbPHE0IAiFA7jBz9F092Kc7guAbacbyZMqVMYvtE_fK6lz-CpbF-qZIcJegT0JjIwwmT3XGvXAV-Yl-KQLHJOUpUzCyKIsfE1o_OfJwmJGUQgciNH4QihyqheOWVcs16k7iLutwr_SZ8jj9YBhq2_xTJQ8ax7uavOyq95g-NzXLE6J3LLC3_t7m0UQ?utm_source=gm&utm_medium=email&auto=true>

<https://ads.google.com/aw/emailsubscriptions/users>

Subject: Re: Ad Audit Report - Setting Up A Call
Body:
Hey Adam - yes Kahli who is on this email can work with you to get you set up in Simplero next week. She is in Australia so Monday late our time she will be back online.


Darcie Purcell
Interim Executive Director, Primal Trust
630.235.7065



> On Oct 17, 2025, at 9:58 AM, Adam Holcomb <adam@fullcirclemedia.co> wrote:
> 
> Hi Cat,
> 
> I find it hard to imagine that Jamie would have intentionally fabricated reports. He did mention facing a technical hurdle connecting the ads with Simplero for tracking, so my assumption is that he may have correlated membership sales with ad spend manually to create those reports.
> 
> I’d like to run a new report comparing ad spend directly against sales data to see what insights we can gather. Would it be possible to get admin access to Simplero? We’ll need that to help set up accurate tracking moving forward.
> 
> Best,
> Adam
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Adam Holcomb
> co-founder + creative director  
> p. 415.572.0559
> 
> Full Circle Media  
> www.fullcirclemedia.co <https://www.fullcirclemedia.co/>
> 
> 
> 
>> On Oct 16, 2025, at 2:22 PM, Cathleen King <drcat@primaltrust.org> wrote:
>> 
>> Thank you, Adam. The summary is very helpful.
>> Jamie had reporting with pretty specific numbers and so that’s what I’m wondering about. 
>>  He showed what he spent and he showed what we made from what we spent and it was a very specific data, and nowhere did he claim that he was estimating or that the data was incomplete. And he was adamant that we were making Several times are spending for ads in these data financial  reports. 
>> So what I am hearing that is different is that the actual ad tracking of return on investment was not adequate or complete in your opinion and looks like the conversion was more around 1x ROI vs 3-4x as I was told by Jamie. 
>> 
>> I have reviewed your three month plan and it makes sense from the little knowledge I have about ads and marketing. Darcie will have a lot more input and I will let her take the lead on giving you direction from here.
>> 
>> Ty!
>> 
>> 
>> Dr. Cathleen King, DPT
>> www.primaltrust.org
>> 
>> “Let yourself be silently drawn by the stronger pull of what you truly love. It will not lead you astray.” -Rumi
>> 
>> 
>> 
>> 
>>> On Oct 16, 2025, at 10:41 AM, Adam Holcomb <adam@fullcirclemedia.co> wrote:
>>> 
>>> ﻿
>>> Hi Cat,
>>> 
>>> Darcie asked me to put together an Executive Summary doc for the ads,  it’s attached. Basically what was already shared. 
>>> 
>>> I don’t want to throw Jamie completely under the bus, because monthly signups are healthy but there was no conversion tracking, so it was impossible to know how ads were truly performing. You’ve had healthy signups, but without tracking, attribution wasn’t visible. Retargeting also wasn’t used effectively, so that is another area to be efficient with saving on ad spending. For example, one campaign had 70K+ views but never followed up with a call to action afterwards. So you invested in audience visibility with people that engaged with the creative, but never followed through with anything else. 
>>> 
>>> The good news is that your creative assets are strong. We’ll rebuild the structure, add tracking, and implement a full retargeting strategy so we can finally see what’s working and optimize for it. Once that’s in place, we’ll have clear data, better efficiency, and a system that can confidently scale. It will be fun creative opportunity to use that data once it’s warmed up to come up with newer campaigns and ideas. 
>>> 
>>> Excited for you to connect with Lindsay and Peterson to walk you through it. 
>>> 
>>> Best,
>>> Adam
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> <PRIMAL TRUST - executive summary.pdf>
>>> 
>>> Adam Holcomb
>>> co-founder + creative director  
>>> p. 415.572.0559
>>> 
>>> Full Circle Media  
>>> www.fullcirclemedia.co <https://www.fullcirclemedia.co/>
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>>>> On Oct 16, 2025, at 9:02 AM, Cathleen King <drcat@primaltrust.org> wrote:
>>>> 
>>>> Thanks, Adam.
>>>> I definitely felt a hit in the stomach when I realized that when I was being told about  our Ad effectiveness and what you found are vastly different.
>>>> 
>>>> Extremely frustrating that I was given the impression that our ads were having a big return on investment.  So I’m trying to digest what feels like betrayal in reporting right now by our last marketing director…. Ugh 
>>>> 
>>>> Anyway, yes, let’s go over things and give me the rundown in a simple of terms as you possibly can about what we need to do differently to have these ads actually be worth our spending.
>>>> And the plan for a follow up Marketing, etc.
>>>> 
>>>> Also, please let me know if there are any assets that you specifically need from me that would help these ad campaigns. Like a specific type of video I should make with some type of basic script or something that can be helpful.
>>>> 
>>>> Ty
>>>> Cat
>>>> Dr. Cathleen King, DPT
>>>> www.primaltrust.org
>>>> 
>>>> “Let yourself be silently drawn by the stronger pull of what you truly love. It will not lead you astray.” -Rumi
>>>> 
>>>> 
>>>> 
>>>> 
>>>>> On Oct 15, 2025, at 8:08 PM, Adam Holcomb <adam@fullcirclemedia.co> wrote:
>>>>> 
>>>>> ﻿
>>>>> HI Team
>>>>> 
>>>>> I’m sharing a link to the summary document (PDF) that outlines key findings from our advertising audit. There’s quite a bit to unpack here but I kept the document simple, so I’d recommend setting up a call to walk through it together.
>>>>> 
>>>>> In short, much of the past ad activity was running without full tracking in place, making true ROI visibility difficult. Based on what we could estimate, performance hovered around a 1.0–1.2x return (we optimistically suspect) — essentially a break-even point. Targeting and follow-up opportunities were also missed. For example, one awareness ad reached over 70,000 people, but there was no retargeting in place to invite them into membership or a deeper call to action.
>>>>> 
>>>>> The good news is that there are some strong creative assets already in your library. Our plan is to reuse the best-performing pieces while applying a proper funnel strategy. Starting with awareness, then discovery (e.g., free newsletter or book), followed by a clear membership offer. This will make ad spend far more efficient.
>>>>> 
>>>>> I’d love to set up a meeting next week, (Cat I believe you like to do calls Tuesdays?) to review everything with you. Peterson and Lindsay can walk through the Meta and Google systems to show what was missing and how we’ll correct it moving forward.
>>>>>

On Oct 16, 2025, at 10:41 AM, Adam Holcomb <adam@fullcirclemedia.co> wrote:

﻿

Hi Cat,

Darcie asked me to put together an Executive Summary doc for the ads,  it’s attached. Basically what was already shared. 

I don’t want to throw Jamie completely under the bus, because monthly signups are healthy but there was no conversion tracking, so it was impossible to know how ads were truly performing. You’ve had healthy signups, but without tracking, attribution wasn’t visible. Retargeting also wasn’t used effectively, so that is another area to be efficient with saving on ad spending. For example, one campaign had 70K+ views but never followed up with a call to action afterwards. So you invested in audience visibility with people that engaged with the creative, but never followed through with anything else. 

The good news is that your creative assets are strong. We’ll rebuild the structure, add tracking, and implement a full retargeting strategy so we can finally see what’s working and optimize for it. Once that’s in place, we’ll have clear data, better efficiency, and a system that can confidently scale. It will be fun creative opportunity to use that data once it’s warmed up to come up with newer campaigns and ideas. 

Excited for you to connect with Lindsay and Peterson to walk you through it. 

Best,
Adam

On Oct 15, 2025, at 8:08 PM, Adam Holcomb <adam@fullcirclemedia.co> wrote:

﻿
HI Team

I’m sharing a link to the summary document (PDF) that outlines key findings from our advertising audit. There’s quite a bit to unpack here but I kept the document simple, so I’d recommend setting up a call to walk through it together.

In short, much of the past ad activity was running without full tracking in place, making true ROI visibility difficult. Based on what we could estimate, performance hovered around a 1.0–1.2x return (we optimistically suspect) — essentially a break-even point. Targeting and follow-up opportunities were also missed. For example, one awareness ad reached over 70,000 people, but there was no retargeting in place to invite them into membership or a deeper call to action.

The good news is that there are some strong creative assets already in your library. Our plan is to reuse the best-performing pieces while applying a proper funnel strategy. Starting with awareness, then discovery (e.g., free newsletter or book), followed by a clear membership offer. This will make ad spend far more efficient.

I’d love to set up a meeting next week, (Cat I believe you like to do calls Tuesdays?) to review everything with you. Peterson and Lindsay can walk through the Meta and Google systems to show what was missing and how we’ll correct it moving forward.

Please let me know what time works best for you. Excited to share where we can take things from here.

 Kahli Toy <kahli@primaltrust.org>
Subject: Ad Audit Report - Setting Up A Call
Body:
HI Team

I’m sharing a link to the summary document (PDF) that outlines key findings from our advertising audit. There’s quite a bit to unpack here but I kept the document simple, so I’d recommend setting up a call to walk through it together.

In short, much of the past ad activity was running without full tracking in place, making true ROI visibility difficult. Based on what we could estimate, performance hovered around a 1.0–1.2x return (we optimistically suspect) — essentially a break-even point. Targeting and follow-up opportunities were also missed. For example, one awareness ad reached over 70,000 people, but there was no retargeting in place to invite them into membership or a deeper call to action.

The good news is that there are some strong creative assets already in your library. Our plan is to reuse the best-performing pieces while applying a proper funnel strategy. Starting with awareness, then discovery (e.g., free newsletter or book), followed by a clear membership offer. This will make ad spend far more efficient.

I’d love to set up a meeting next week, (Cat I believe you like to do calls Tuesdays?) to review everything with you. Peterson and Lindsay can walk through the Meta and Google systems to show what was missing and how we’ll correct it moving forward.

Please let me know what time works best for you. Excited to share where we can take things from here.


Summary: https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/yh9i4otfqxaf1981dk3lq/primal-trust.pdf?rlkey=5hry7ozan9gmwem6xk71egn5s&dl=0
All Reports: https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/qr377w5j4nemzbxn3g2mf/AJk_-mpSmvPZiJVGWIpb7r4?rlkey=y2bao9hrq10qabjwjud1c6kab&dl=0



Adam Holcomb
co-founder + creative director  
p. 415.572.0559

Full Circle Media  
www.fullcirclemedia.co <https://www.fullcirclemedia.co/>
